content: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is a technique that enhances LLMs by incorporating external context from a document store.
Embeddings are numerical representations of text that capture semantic meaning and are used for similarity search.
FAISS is an open-source library by Facebook that allows for efficient similarity search over dense vectors.
ChromaDB is a modern vector database designed for fast retrieval and ease of integration with LLMs.
Semantic search allows queries to return contextually similar results even if they don't share exact keywords.
